biography.summary: Long-serving United States Senator from Idaho (Republican), first elected to the Senate in 1998 and serving since 1999, with a focus on fiscal responsibility, energy, and Western state issues.
biography.early_life: Born May 20, 1951 in Idaho; pursued higher education and entered public service.
biography.education: Attended Idaho public schools; earned a professional degree in law.
biography.career: Public servant with long tenure in Idaho before being elected to the U.S. Senate, where he has served on key committees.

contact.office_address: 239 Dirksen Senate Office Building Washington DC 20510

timeline.event: Assumed office as United States Senator from Idaho.
Continued service in the U.S. Senate.
